description: vegetable +â€Ž -arian; popularized following 1847 foundation of British Vegetarian Society.

adjectives.description: vegetarian (comparative more vegetarian, superlative most vegetarian)

entries.meaning: Of or relating to the type of diet eaten by vegetarians (in all senses). [from 1849]
Of a product normally made with meat, having non-meat substitutes in place of meat.
examples: Is there such a thing as a good tasting vegetarian hot dog? Cuz every one I've tried tasted like smelted tire.

entries.meaning: A person who does not eat animal flesh, or, in some cases, use any animal products. [from 1839]
examples: "The sight and smell of raw meat are especially odious to me, and I have often thought that if I had had to be my own cook, I should inevitably become a vegetarian, probably, indeed, return entirely to my green and salad days."

entries.meaning: An animal that eats only plants; a herbivore.
